Caption: The dignitaries casually conversing with one another. From left; Prof. B. Sengupto, Sir C.V. Raman, Dr. A.L. Mudaliar and Mr. Venkataraman. Seen behind (from left to right) are Mr. C.V. Sethunathan and Prof. S. Sampath.
Description: The third convocation of IIT Madras was held on the 30thof July, 1966. The convocation took place on a Saturday evening at the Instituteâ€™s Open Air Theater. The Chief Guest and speaker, at this historic event for the Institute, was none other than Dr. C. V. Raman, the Indian Physicist and awardee of the Nobel Prize and Bharat Ratna, for his ground breaking works in the area of light scattering. Dr. A. L. Mudaliar (Padma Bhushan, Padma Vibhushan), the chairman of the Board of Governors, presided over the ceremony. This photo was captured as some of the dignitaries conversed casually with one another at the event.  From left; Prof. B. Sengupto (First Director of IITM), Sir C.V. Raman, Dr. A.L. Mudaliar and Mr.Venkataraman (Chief Security Officer). Seen behind (from left to right) are Mr. C.V. Sethunathan and Prof. S. Sampath (Head of the Electrical Engineering department).
